sentence.Network_en: The horrors he experienced are imprinted, perhaps indelibly, in his brain.
sentence.Network_cn: 他经历的恐怖事件在他脑海中刻下了深深的，或许是难以磨灭的印记。

sentence.Network_en: The terrible scenes were indelibly imprinted on his mind.
sentence.Network_cn: 那些恐怖场面深深地铭刻在他的心中。

sentence.Network_en: The shining image of Premier Zhou Enlai is indelibly engraved on the memory of the people.
sentence.Network_cn: 周总理的光辉形象永远铭刻在人民的心中.

entry.def: If you say that something leaves an indelible impression, you mean that it is very unlikely to be forgotten.

example.ex: My visit to India in 1986 left an indelible impression on me...
example.tran: 1986年的印度之行给我留下了难忘的印象。

example.ex: The war has made an indelible mark on the world.
example.tran: 战争给世人留下了不可磨灭的印记。

entry.tran: 难以去除的;洗不掉的;擦不掉的
entry.def: Indelible ink or an indelible stain cannot be removed or washed out.

example.ex: It leaves indelible stains on clothes.
example.tran: 它会在衣物上留下洗不掉的污渍。

sentences.sentence: "this tradition has left its mark indelibly upon the social, political, educational and industrial fabric of this country"

auth_sentence.content: Gabriele remained indelibly Italian, a typical Neopolitan.
auth_sentence.res_content: Gabriele remained indelibly Italian, a typical Neopolitan.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Gabriele remained indelibly Italian, a typical Neopolitan.

auth_sentence.content: It's indelibly Darwin and monkeys, said Prof Costa.
auth_sentence.res_content: It's indelibly Darwin and monkeys, said Prof Costa.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It's indelibly Darwin and monkeys, said Prof Costa.

auth_sentence.content: It's indelibly etched into their minds.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It's indelibly etched into their minds.
